X.T: YUI Theater — Ron Adams: "Automated Integration Testing with YUI Test, Selenium and Hudson"

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A presentation of a TDD environment: unit test framework (YUITest) + test driver (Selenium) + continuous integration (Hudson).

X.T: John Resig: Testing, Performance Analysis, and jQuery 1.4

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A list of some JavaScript unit tests and performance tools, some JQuery news (performance improvements, event bubbling…) and some comment on using HTML 5 on Internet Explorer.

X.T: Test your app from right to left

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Google releases bidichecker, an open source verifying bidirectional text.

X.T: Why Automated Testing for Web Apps?

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A list of tools, very quickly described, for unit tests, test automation, and continuous integration of Web applications.

X.T: Creating Maintainable Automated Acceptance Test Suites

ARTICLE.COMMENT:
(slideshttps://www.slideshare.net/jezhumble/creating-maintainable-automated-acceptance-tests
enHTML) A lot of advice based on fives principles: treat acceptance tests like production code, always interact with the SUT like a user would, continuously curate your user journeys, collective ownership of acceptance tests, acceptance tests own their data.
A description of the design pattern used to hide the HTML details and present a semantic API to the test script.

X.T: A Behavior Driven Developer's guide to Infrastructure as Code

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Using Molecule to implement BDD tests for validating deployments done with Ansible.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some good but very basic information about automated tests and load tests.

X.T: On the Diverse And Fantastical Shapes of Testing
X.ST: Pyramids, honeycombs, trophies, and the meaning of unit testing

ARTICLE.COMMENT: It is worthless to speak about the shape of the tests since people do not mean the same when speaking about "unit test" or about "integration test".

X.T: Using Fit: An Open-Source Testing Framework

ARTICLE.COMMENT: This description of Fit is not clear: instead of speaking of the mechanisms of Fit (such as the fixtures between the storytests and the AUT), RickMugridge spends his time trying to convince the audience about the interest of storytests, but his discourse is messy.

X.T: Why I recommend against using Cucumber
